document_data.name: Nine Lords Errant
document_data.author: [[Narelra Manecandle]]
document_data.mainbody:
'''''Nine Lords Errant''''' was a play written by [[Narelra Manecandle]] of [[Athkatla]] in the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]]. {{quote|''My lords, let us sport together a while
For the moon welcomes and the stars are out
The [[wine]] is at hand, and I do think me 'tis
A nice night for murder.''|Amlaric Amend-All, in Act I, Scene II, of ''Nine Lords Errant.''}}
document_data.History: Narelra Manecandle, Playwright of Athkatla, penned the ''Nine Lords Errant'' play sometime before the {{YearlinkName|1380}}. The play's first performance was held in 1380 DR. The play's protagonist was Amlaric Amend-All, who, along with several coconspirators, plotted a murder most foul.
